page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: The majority of this area can be described as coastal farmland.It includes two main villages,the smaller of the two being Howick. Howick is a small village of only a few houses owned by Howick Charitable Trust.Howick Hall and gardens are our main tourist attraction;the hall dating from 1782 when it was built by Sir Henry Grey. Longhoughton,the larger village,is used by the R.A.F.as quarters for servicemen stationed at the nearby radar base at Boulmer.The school is at Longhoughton,as well as a community centre which is used by many clubs, societies,clinics etc. The beaches along the coast are beautiful,although unsafe for bathing: all in all a perfect mixture of countryside and sea.
